message_1: A committee of 4 people is to be chosen from a group of 8 people. In how many ways can this committee be chosen?
message_2:
To find the number of ways to choose a committee of 4 people from a group of 8 people, we can use the combination formula, which is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of people (8 in this case), k is the number of people to be chosen (4 in this case), and ! denotes the factorial function.

So, we have:

C(8, 4) = 8! / (4!(8-4)!)

C(8, 4) = 8! / (4!4!)

C(8, 4) = (8 × 7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((4 × 3 × 2 × 1)(4 × 3 × 2 × 1))

C(8, 4) = (8 × 7 × 6 × 5) / (4 × 3 × 2 × 1)

C(8, 4) = 1680 / 24

C(8, 4) = 70

So, there are 70 ways to choose a committee of 4 people from a group of 8 people.
